pages.text: At night, the undead rise.$(br2)The $(thing)zombie$() is the most common of them, making up the "infantry" of the nightly hordes of monsters.$(br2)While the $(thing)zombie$() by itself is not much of a threat, only being able to harm via direct touch, it is in their numbers that their strengths lie; congregating in packs, ready to gang up

on the unsuspecting, using some form of silent communication to alert the others, coordinate their attacks, and even summon more of their brethren to rise from the ground, if necessary.$(br2)The $(thing)zombie$() is also a hungry creature with a keen sense of smell, and in pursuit of sustenance it will perform all manner of tricks and maneuvers to get to the flesh it so craves: digging, breaking, and smashing

through any obstacles, riding their own undead cavalry, wielding shields, weapons, pickaxes, and even explosives, all while running, jumping, and strafing towards their target, and fleeing, if in critical condition.$(br2)To think that every night, overwhelming numbers of these creatures rise, seeking out any living, sentient peoples and hunting them down ruthlessly and
unceasingly; no wonder the world is so sparsely populated. If I am to stay alive, I must utilize every measure I can to beat back the night and fight fervently for my own survival.
